description: Tests must fail if a fallback or default branch is executed. Every assertion should cover the explicitly intended path so that regressions do not hide behind fallback/default handling.

do.description: Assert the specific behavior path is taken and no fallback is triggered

dont.description: Let a fallback path pass the test instead of exercising the real requirement
content: assert result.stage == 'default_flow'  # WRONG - this is the fallback path
assert result.used_fallback is True      # Wrong because fallback masks missing coverage
